Bolton are hosting Bristol Rovers on Friday. With the 1-2 away win at Fleetwood, Bolton Wanderers went back to winning ways after 2 winless matches, extending their unbeaten run to 2 matches in the league. Bristol Rovers went back to winning ways after 4 winless matches, extending their unbeaten run to 2 matches in the league after their 1-0 home win against Peterborough.

Bolton's progression (home & away)
Line graph variation: win:+2draw:0defeat:-1





Bristol Rovers' progression (home & away)
Line graph variation: win:+2draw:0defeat:-1

Bolton form

With the 1-2 away win at Fleetwood, Bolton Wanderers went back to winning ways after 2 winless matches, extending their unbeaten run to 2 matches in the league. Bolton Wanderers have conceded an average of 0.83 goals per game since the beginning of the season in the league. Bolton form stats indicate an average number of goals conceded per game of 1.13 in the last 8 league matches, which is 36.1% higher than their current season's average.
A majority of Bolton's wins have been obtained with a one-goal margin (5 wins), while 4 of their wins had a margin of 2 goals or more. A majority of Bolton's defeats had a margin of 2 goals or more (3 defeats), while 2 of their defeats had a one-goal margin.
67% of Bolton's matches had under 2.5 goals in total. Bolton have scored 33% of their goals after the 75th minute. More information is available on the Bolton stats page.



Bristol Rovers form

With the 1-0 home win against Peterborough, Bristol Rovers went back to winning ways after 4 winless matches, extending their unbeaten run to 2 matches in the league. The team has won 4 of their last 8 matches in League One. Bristol Rovers stats show the team has picked up an average of 1.26 points per league game since the beginning of the season. Their form stats indicate that in the last 8 league matches the team's points per game value has been averaging 1.88, which is 49.2% higher than their current season's average.
A majority of Bristol Rovers' wins have been obtained with a one-goal margin (4 wins), while 2 of their wins had a margin of 2 goals or more. A majority of Bristol Rovers' defeats had a margin of 2 goals or more (5 defeats), while 2 of their defeats had a one-goal margin.
Bristol Rovers have scored in each of their last 9 matches. Bristol Rovers have scored in 7 of their 9 away matches. Bristol Rovers have scored in each of their last 5 away matches. 27% of Bristol Rovers's conceded goals occurred in the first 15 minutes. More information is available on the Bristol Rovers stats page.

Outcome scenarios (this season in the league)

If Bolton win, Bolton would increase their lead over Bristol Rovers to 10 points in the league table.
If the match ends in a draw, Bolton would remain 7 points ahead of Bristol Rovers in the league table.
If Bristol Rovers win, Bristol Rovers would reduce the gap with Bolton to a 4-point difference in the league table.

Over 7.5 total corners, over 8.5 total corners etc.: matches where the total number of corners (team corners + opponent corners) was over a given value.

4 9 Goals giving lead to opponent 15 7

50% 44% Equalizing rate * (2) 53% 43%

Home Total NON-CRUCIAL GOALS Total Away
5 7 Non-crucial goals scored 12 8
3 5 Non-crucial goals conceded 14 8

(1) 100 - ((Equalizer goals conceded / Goals giving the lead) * 100)
(2) (Equalizer goals scored / Goals giving lead to opponent) * 100

Non-crucial goals scored: goals scored that increased an existing lead, or decreased the opponent's existing lead.
Non-crucial goals conceded: goals conceded that decreased an existing lead, or increased the opponent's existing lead.

Note regarding the Goals giving the lead and the Goals giving lead to opponent values: both the team and the opponent team might take the lead more than once during a single match, so the total number of goals giving the lead to a team might be higher than the number of matches played by the team. For more info on how many times each team has taken the lead per match, how many times per match their opponents have taken the lead, or how many time each team has scored the first goal this season in League One you may want to view the following pages:

The Segments Table is a visual representation splitting the teams into 5 segments. Each team is assigned to a specific segment, depending on the team's number of points. Each of the 5 segments spans one-fifth (20%) of the total points held by the team ranked 1st in the league. For each team, the number of matches played appears in green between brackets, and the number of points is displayed in black.

Calling SoccerSTATS.com supporters


SHOW YOUR SUPPORT


by becoming a member and

enjoy an AD-FREE experience

on SoccerSTATS.com



View demo AD-FREE pages


At SoccerSTATS.com we live and breathe football, statistics, and analysis. Since 1998 when our website was first published, and even earlier when it had a different name, our goal has been to combine some of our passions into a media that like-minded visitors would find fun to explore.

Beyond the entertainment, our hope is that this website finds its place somewhere along the daily or weekly digital path of people who love football as much as we do.

Advertising revenue has been keeping the site alive through the years and our intention has always been to maintain a balance between the indispensable ad-based funding and improving the user experience as much as possible.

In the last few months our advertising revenue has been affected - like so many other publications - by the global economic environment. Our website is no exception and like everything else it needs to adapt to survive. So it's time for the project to start a new chapter, keep what's working and adapt what's not.

We will of course continue to work on improving the website's content and listen to the feedback from our loyal visitors. From now on we are implementing the tools to provide those among our users who have been asking for a way to navigate the site with no advertisements, with a simple way to get the best browsing experience we can offer. This is why we have partnered with Steady to provide our users with an option to become a member.

In a nutshell, by becoming a member:

- you can browse through the website with no advertising

- you help keep the website going

To get an idea of the advertising-free experience available site-wide to logged-in members, you can view the pages related to the following league.

Who knows what else this new chapter of the website's existence will lead us to. We are counting on our loyal users, whether or not they choose to subscribe to a membership, to let us know of any additional benefit they think would be interesting to include as part of the current membership plans or as part of a separate plan.

Let's make the most of this opportunity to shape up this emerging community, where football stats fans can thrive. This will not only help make the website better, but also give us some new opportunities to interact with each other and share ideas on how to digitally fuel our passion for this sport even further.


SoccerSTATS.com membership page at Steady
